title: Lake Berryessa shooting suspect arrested by Napa County authorities
message:
A North Bay man was arrested on suspicion of fatally shooting another person during a brawl at Lake Berryessa on Saturday, according to a news release from the Napa County Sheriff’s Office.
One person was fatally shot and at least five people were stabbed during a large fight June 8 on the shore of Lake Berryessa, the Napa County Sheriff’s Office said.
The shooting victim was identified as Andrew Fabian Sandoval Garcia, a 39-year-old Vallejo resident.
According to Sheriff’s Office spokesman Henry Wofford, two people with stab wounds were airlifted to local hospitals in serious condition.
The cause of the fight and how many people were involved has yet to be determined by investigators.
event_breakdown:
1. A North Bay man was arrested on suspicion of fatally shooting another person during a brawl at Lake Berryessa on Saturday. The man was later identified as Andrew Fabian Sandoval Garcia, a 39-year-old Vallejo resident.
2. One person was fatally shot and at least five people were stabbed during a large fight on the shore of Lake Berryessa on June 8. The shooting victim was identified as Andrew Fabian Sandoval Garcia, a 39-year-old Vallejo resident.

BEIRUT, June 11 (Xinhua) -- Lebanese security sources said on Wednesday that an Israeli airstrike hit a house in the southeastern town of Tyre late on Tuesday, killing a senior military leader of the Lebanese Hezbollah movement and three others.
The Israeli army said in a statement that it attacked targets in southern Lebanon during the night in response to the firing of about 100 rockets from Lebanon into the western Galilee in northern Israel the previous day.
The Lebanese army told news agency Xinhua that an Israeli aircraft violated the country's airspace at 2:40 a.m. local time (0040GMT) on Wednesday and carried out two airstrikes on the outskirts of the town of Ethna, in the Bekaa countryside.

title: BREAKING : IDF Eliminates Senior Hezbollah Official ; Highest Ranking Officer Neutralized Since Oct . 7
message:
Posted on by SeekAndFindReports are emerging that the IDF hit a significant Hezbollah target in Lebanon on Tuesday afternoon.
According to the reports, an Israeli strike in Jouya, in southern Lebanon, killed at least four Hezbollah officials.
Hezbollah identified the killed commander by his rank in a statement, naming him as Taleb Abdallah.
The sources, who spoke on condition of anonymity, said the commander's role in Hezbollah was as significant as that of Wissam Tawil, a senior Hezbollah commander killed in an Israeli strike in January.
MAJOR UPDATE: The IDF had intel about the Hezbollah senior commander's secret meeting; they hit the meeting place and took out two of their most senior commanders.
event_breakdown: IDF hit a significant Hezbollah target in Lebanon (exact location: Jouya, in southern Lebanon) on Tuesday afternoon, killing at least four Hezbollah officials. Hezbollah identified the killed commander by his rank in a statement, naming him as Taleb Abdallah.

title: Woman found guilty in 2023 fatal Springfield nightclub stabbing
message:
SPRINGFIELD, Mass.
(WGGB/WSHM) - A woman found guilty of manslaughter on Tuesday in connection to a fatal stabbing in Springfield.
In January of last year, Springfield Police responded to the top shelf nightclub for reports of a stabbing victim.
Officers said the attack started outside the nightclub on chestnut street, and they found the victim in a parking lot across the street.
She pleaded not guilty to murder charges in January of 2023 and on Tuesday she has been found guilty of manslaughter.

title: Russia launches missile and drone attack on Kyiv , Ukraine military says
message:
KYIV (Reuters) - Russia launched a missile and drone attack on Kyiv early on Wednesday with preliminary information showing there were no injuries or damage in the Ukrainian capital, Ukrainian military said.
Ukraine's air defence systems destroyed all air weapons on their approach to the city, Serhiy Popko, head of Kyiv's military administration said on the Telegram messaging app.
He added that according to preliminary information, Russia used a combination of cruise and ballistic missiles as well as drones in its attack.
That is often the case when Russia launches an air attack on Ukraine's western regions.
(Reporting by Valentyn Ogirenko and Sergiy Karazy; Writing by Lidia Kelly in Melbourne; Editing by Himani Sarkar and Michael Perry)
event_breakdown:
1. A Russian missile and drone attack devastated a shopping centre in Kremenchuk in central Ukraine on Monday.
2. Russia launched a missile strike on Kyiv early on Wednesday. Preliminary information showed that no injuries or damage had been reported.

title: Three FC men injured in IED attack near Kuchlak - Newspaper
message:
QUETTA: Three Frontier Corps personnel have been injured in an IED attack near Kuchlak at the Quetta-Chaman Highway late on Tuesday night.
According to officials, the IED exploded close to the personnel’s vehicle, which was damaged as a result of the powerful blast.
The window panes of a nearby building were smashed due to the explosion’s intensity.
Police and FC personnel shifted the injured soldiers to Quetta’s Combined Military Hospital.
“It seems like a remote control IED blast,” a senior police officer posted in Kuchlak told Dawn.
event_breakdown:

title: Convicted killer Paul Flores moved to another prison over safety concerns
message:
Kristin Smart's killer, Paul Flores, has been moved to a new prison for safety reasons.
The move comes after Flores was attacked twice at Pleasant Valley State Prison in Coalinga.
In April of this year, prison staff reportedly witnessed another inmate stabbing Flores in the recreation yard.
According to his attorney, Harold Mesick, Flores was moved to Corcoran State Prison on June 6.
Flores was initially placed at Pleasant Valley State Prison last August to begin serving his 25 years-to-life sentence for Smart's murder.

Target Event: Kristin Smart's killer, Paul Flores, moved to a new prison

title: Chicago crime : South Loop man Ivan Weldon charged in 3 CTA Green Line attacks
message:
South Loop man charged in 3 CTA Green Line attacksCHICAGO -- A South Loop man remains jailed on attempted murder and battery charges in connection with several attacks on CTA passengers.
Ivan Weldon, 42, is accused of using a box cutter to slice a 48-year-old man's neck and stabbing him multiple times May 31 on a Green Line train near the Garfield station, 320 E. Garfield Boulevard.
Weldon faces three felony charges in connection with that attack: attempted murder, aggravated battery in a public place and aggravated battery causing great bodily harm.
On the same day, Weldon allegedly attacked two more passengers at the CTA Green Line Bronzeville stop, 16 E. 35th St.
Two felony counts each of aggravated battery in a public place and aggravated battery were filed in those attacks.

title: Man who led SLO County police on chase during 2023 crime spree sentenced
message:
San Luis Obispo County District Attorney Dan Dow announced Tuesday the sentencing of a Visalia man who led county law enforcement on a chase during a 2023 crime spree.
Joshua Lee Arnold was sentenced to serve 26 years plus 28 years to life in prison for attempted murder and assault with a handgun during a crime spree.
It happened on August 17, 2023, when at approximately 1:00 pm, Arnold attempted to rob a clerk at a 7-Eleven in Grover Beach.
Multiple agencies assisted in the investigation, including the Grover Beach Police Department, the San Luis Obispo County Sheriff’s Office, the San Luis Obispo Police Department, and the San Luis Obispo County District Attorney’s Office Bureau of Investigation.
On April 9, 2024, Arnold pleaded no contest to three counts of attempted murder with deliberation and premeditation, and two counts of assault with a semiautomatic firearm.

title: Ukraine war briefing : Washington clears Azov brigade for US weapons and training
message:
The US has lifted a ban on providing weapons and training to Ukraine’s Azov Brigade, which had far-right roots but proved key to the defence of the major port city of Mariupol.
Azov was absorbed into Ukraine’s national guard as the 12th Special Forces Brigade and current members reject accusations of extremism and ties with far-right movements.
US law prohibits providing equipment and training to foreign military units or individuals suspected of committing gross human rights violations.
“This is a new page in our unit’s history,” the Azov Brigade said in a statement.
Speaking in Madrid recently, Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, said Ukraine needed another seven Patriot systems to defend against Russian strikes.

title: A Dutch court is delivering verdicts in the trial of 9 suspects in the slaying of reporter De Vries
message:
AMSTERDAM (AP) — A Dutch court is delivering verdicts Wednesday in the trial of nine men suspected of involvement in the assassination three years ago of popular campaigning journalist Peter R. de Vries on a busy Amsterdam street.
Prosecutors have sought convictions and life sentences for the man charged with gunning down De Vries on July 6, 2021, the alleged getaway driver and a man suspected of organizing the assassination.
In January, prosecutors requested sentences ranging from three to 21 years for the six other suspects in the case.
Judges called him the “undisputed leader” of a “murder organization.”Taghi has not been charged with involvement in the assassination of De Vries and prosecutors have not charged any suspects with ordering him killed.
Prosecutors told judges at Amsterdam District Court that the weapon used to shoot de Vries was found in their car.
event_breakdown:
AMSTERDAM (AP) — A Dutch court sentenced alleged hired killer Delano G. to life in jail Wednesday for the daylight shooting of prominent crime reporter Peter R. de Vries three years ago.
Adrianus Van Nieuwenhuizen was sentenced to 21 years as the convicted man’s accomplice, also for premeditated murder.
Quincy G. was given a sentence of 17 years as the getaway driver in the July 6, 2021, shooting of de Vries on an Amsterdam street. Prosecutors alleged that none of the defendants planned to fire the initial shots.
Judges rejected the defense claim that Delano G. fired the shot that killed de Vries because the former Dutch politician’s body guard had pointed a gun at him.
A niece of the accused leader of a Netherlands-based gang sat behind the defendants.
Dutchman Ridouan Taghi is wanted in a Dutch court but believed to be living in his native Morocco after fleeing a high-security prison near Rotterdam in March 2020.
The Amsterdam court did not make a final judgment about the role of paramount alleged gang leader Ridouan Taghi in the assassination an organization led by Amsterdam gang member “Ansu.” (That pronoun is grammatically incorrect because of lack of objective male pronouns in Dutch).
The court said it was unable to bring Taghi to justice.

title: Verdict due in Dutch crime reporter killing
message:
Peter R. de Vries was a household name in the Netherlands (Remko de Waal)A Dutch court will on Wednesday hand down a long-awaited verdict over the 2021 assassination of high-profile crime journalist Peter R. de Vries, a killing that shocked the country.
Police arrested two suspects, identified only as Dutchman Delano G. and Kamil E. from Poland, shortly after the shooting.
The celebrity journalist then moved into television, where he ran his own crime programme called "Peter R. de Vries, Crime Reporter".
Crown Princess Amalia, the daughter of King Willem-Alexander, was forced to move to Spain for her studies due to fears of an attack from an organised crime group.
Both the royal and Prime Minister Mark Rutte were mentioned in messages by organised crime groups, raising fears of plans to kidnap or attack them.

title: The Latest | Rockets Fired from Lebanon after Israel Kills Hezbollah Commander
message:
Scores of rockets were fired from Lebanon toward northern Israel on Wednesday morning, hours after Israeli airstrikes killed four officials from the militant Hezbollah group including a senior military commander.
His death came amid rising escalation along the Lebanon-Israel border that has seen Hezbollah intensify its attacks on northern Israel while Israeli airstrikes have struck deep inside Lebanon.
Israel launched the war after Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack, in which militants stormed into southern Israel, killed some 1,200 people — mostly civilians — and abducted about 250.
Hezbollah’s Al-Manar TV reported that rockets were being fired from south Lebanon into northern Israel.
Hezbollah published a photo of Abdullah alongside Wissam al-Tawil, another senior commander killed in an Israeli strike in January.

She’s already serving time for attempted murder after shooting her firearms instructor in 2015.

title: Key Sudanese city could fall to rebels imminently - US
message:
(AFP)The United States' envoy to Sudan has warned that El Fasher, a besieged city in western Darfur, could fall to rebel forces imminently.
El Fasher is the only city still under army control in the western Darfur region.
America's warning about the fall of El Fasher follows weeks of bloody fighting in the city.
El Fasher had been a sanctuary for many who had fled their homes because of the conflict.
The constant shelling in El Fasher has sent tens of thousands fleeing once again.

title: North Korean Soldiers Crossing Border Was A Mistake : Seoul After Illegal Entry Reports
message:
North Korean soldiers breached the South border Photo : APSouth Korea clarified that North Korean soldiers crossing its border was simply 'a mistake', further adding that the 20-odd troops were 'not all armed' and returned promptly after a warning fire.
On Tuesday, South Korean military confirmed that it fired warning shots after 20-30 North Korean troops briefly violated the tense border earlier in the week.
According to the military statement, at 12:30 PM on Sunday, some North Korean soldiers who were engaged in unspecified work on the northern side of the border crossed the military demarcation line that bisects the two countries.
The soldiers immediately returned to their territory after South Korea’s military fired warning shots and issued warning broadcasts, the Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
The 248-kilometer (155-mile) -long, 4-kilometer (2.5-mile) -wide DMZ is the world’s most heavily armed border.

North Korea, South Korea] North Korean soldiers briefly cross DMZ into South Korea
The incident happened at 12:30 p.m. local time on Sunday. By 1:05 p.m., all of the soldiers had returned to North Korea. The South Korean military was spotted firing warning shots during the incident.
Incidents like this have happened before along the DMZ, a heavily fortified border separating the two countries that was established at the end of the Korean War in 1953.

title: 160 rockets fired at northern Israel : Israeli Army
message:
Jerusalem, June 12 (IANS): About 160 rockets were fired from Lebanon at northern Israel on Wednesday morning, said the Israeli army, after Israeli airstrikes killed four Hezbollah officials, including a senior commander.
The National Fire and Rescue Authority said that the rockets caused fires in several areas, reports Xinhua news agency.
Later in the morning, a barrage of some 70 rockets was fired toward Western Galilee and Mount Meron in Upper Galilee region, where a key aerial defense control unit is located.
In response to the latest barrage, Israeli aircraft struck the launcher in the area of Yaroun.
The Upper Galilee Regional Council called on residents to reduce outdoor activities to essential ones only, citing fear of additional barrages.
event_breakdown: Event 1: about 160 rockets were fired from Lebanon at northern Israel - Reported on June 12, 2019

title: Military intelligence confirms 2 Russian Su - 57 aircraft hit in recent strike
message:
Ukraine's military intelligence (HUR) can confirm that two of the Russian Su-57 fighter jets were hit during a strike on the Akhtubinsk airfield in Astrakhan Oblast, but one of them suffered only light damage, the agency's spokesperson, Andrii Yusov, said on air on June 12.
"We can now say that one Su-57 suffered significant damage, and the other one suffered lighter damage and may be possible to restore," Yusov said.
The military intelligence agency reported on the attack on June 9, marking the first hit against this model of aircraft.
The Su-57 is Russia's most modern fighter jet, with only a few units in service in the Russian Air Force.
Military intelligence does not usually claim public responsibility for attacks on Russian territory, but sources told the Kyiv Independent that Ukraine has carried out a number of long-range strikes against military and industrial targets deep inside the Russian borders.
event_breakdown: Two Su-57 fighter jets were hit during a strike on the Akhtubinsk airfield in Astrakhan Oblast, Russia.

title: Israel , Hamas committed war crimes in Gaza : UN
message:
Geneva: Both Israel and Hamas in the Gaza Strip have committed war crimes since the conflict there erupted October 7 last year, according to a report by the UN Human Rights Council Wednesday.
“It is imperative that all those who have committed crimes be held accountable,” said the chair of the UN Human Rights Council Commission, Navi Pillay.
The commission lists attacks on civilians, torture, inhumane and cruel treatment and hostage-taking as war crimes committed by the military arm of the Islamist Hamas movement and six other armed groups.
The report, presented in Geneva, is written by a commission of independent experts appointed by the UN Human Rights Council.
The UN Human Rights Office has repeatedly spoken of war crimes on both sides.

message:

title: Israel confirms killing of senior Hezbollah commander in S . Lebanon - Xinhua
message:
JERUSALEM, June 12 (Xinhua) -- The Israeli military confirmed on Wednesday that it killed a senior Hezbollah commander, Sami Taleb Abdullah, in southern Lebanon in an airstrike on Tuesday.
"As part of the strike, Sami Taleb Abdullah, the commander of the Nasr Unit in Hezbollah, was eliminated," the military said in a statement, adding that he was "one of Hezbollah's most senior commanders in southern Lebanon."
The center was used to direct attacks from southeastern Lebanon against Israel, and 55-year-old Abdullah, known within Hezbollah as Hajj Abu Taleb, was its commander, according to the Israeli military.
On Wednesday morning, Hezbollah announced it had launched retaliatory attacks using rockets, drones, and missiles on military sites in northern Israel.
According to the Israeli military, at least 170 projectiles were fired from Lebanon toward Israel.
event_breakdown: IDF confirms a commander of Hezbollah, Sami Taleb Abdullah, was eliminated in an Israeli air strike in Al-Adisa, southern Lebanon.

title: Hezbollah vows to intensify attacks against Israel after senior military commander is killed
message:
BEIRUT — Hezbollah vowed Wednesday to intensify its attacks along the Lebanon-Israel border to avenge the killing of its most senior military commander by Israel since the latest round of violence began eight months ago.
“Our response after the martyrdom of Abu Taleb will be to intensify our operations in severity, strength, quantity and quality,” senior Hezbollah official Hachem Saffieddine said during a funeral ceremony for Taleb Sami Abdullah.
Air raid sirens sounded across northern Israel on Wednesday morning, and the military said about 160 projectiles were fired from southern Lebanon — one of the largest attacks since the latest fighting began.
The Israeli military said the attack was part of a strike on a Hezbollah command and control center used to direct attacks against Israel in recent months.
“Abdullah was one of Hezbollah’s most senior commanders in southern Lebanon who planned, advanced and carried out” a large number of attacks against Israeli civilians, the military said.

Location: Israel, Lebanon
Information:
Military sirens sound across northern Israel after 160 projectiles are fired from southern Lebanon by "Hezbollah." Hezbollah vows to intensify attacks on Israel.

title: Ukraine says it struck Russian missile systems in Crimea - Xinhua

KIEV, June 12 (Xinhua) -- The Ukrainian military carried out missile strikes on Russian missile systems S-300 and S-400 in southern Crimea early Wednesday, the General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces said in a statement.
The radar of the S-300 missile system stationed near the Belbek airfield was destroyed in the strike, the statement said.

On Monday, the General Staff said that Ukrainian forces had struck two Russian S-300 complexes and one S-400 complex in Crimea.

The Chinese government is said to be detaining up to 1 million Uighurs and other Muslims in re-education camps. Satellite images of a model village in Xinjiang show evidence of the existence of a detention camp.
Philippine police shootout
Philippine police killed 17 people in a gunfight. Police said the men they fought were armed members of an extremist Islamic group.

title: United Nations inquiry finds war crimes by both Israel , Hamas in Gaza conflict
message:
United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres at the United Nations Headquarters in New York City, US, November 6, 2023.
PHOTO: REUTERSA United Nations inquiry found on Wednesday that both Israel and Hamas had committed war crimes early in the Gaza war, and that Israel's actions also constituted crimes against humanity because of the immense civilian losses.
Israel, which did not cooperate with the commission, dismissed the findings as the result of anti-Israeli bias.
The war began on October 7 when militants led by Hamas, the Islamist group ruling Gaza, killed 1,200 Israelis and took more than 250 hostage, according to Israeli tallies.
Lebanon's Hezbollah militia, backed by Iran, fired barrages of rockets at Israel on Wednesday in retaliation for an Israeli strike that killed a senior Hezbollah field commander.

-Israel and Hamas engaged in a war from 7 October 2023
-Attack on Israel from Lebanon on Wednesday 11 October 2023

title: Both Israel And Hamas Committed War Crimes In Gaza : UN
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Geneva, June 12 (IANS/DPA) Both Israel and Hamas in the Gaza Strip have committed war crimes since the conflict there erupted on October 7 last year, according to a report by the UN Human Rights Council on Wednesday.
"It is imperative that all those who have committed crimes be held accountable," said the chair of the UN Human Rights Council Commission, Navi Pillay.
Israel's war crimes include starving the population as a means of warfare, deliberate on civilians and civilian objects, sexual violence, torture and inhuman or cruel treatment, the UN Rights Council reported.
The commission lists attacks on civilians, torture, inhumane and cruel treatment and hostage-taking as war crimes committed by the military arm of the Islamist Hamas movement and six other armed groups.
The UN Human Rights Office has repeatedly spoken of war crimes on both sides.

title: UN inquiry finds Israel , Hamas both committed war crimes
message:
GENEVA — Both Israel and Hamas committed war crimes in the early stages of the Gaza war, a UN inquiry found on Wednesday, saying that Israel’s actions also constituted crimes against humanity because of the immense civilian losses.
The COI says Israel obstructs its work and prevented investigators from accessing both Israel and the occupied Palestinian territories.
The reports, which cover the conflict through to end-December, found that both sides committed war crimes including torture; murder or willful killing; outrages upon personal dignity; and inhuman or cruel treatment.
Some of the war crimes such as murder also constituted crimes against humanity by Israel, the COI statement said, using a term reserved for the most serious international crimes knowingly committed as part of a widespread or systematic attack against civilians.
Sometimes, the evidence gathered by such UN-mandated bodies has formed the basis for war crimes prosecutions and could be drawn on by the International Criminal Court.
event_breakdown: Evidence collected by the UN-mandated COI and no relevant event found.

title: UN probe accuses Israel of crimes against humanity , Hamas of war crimes
message:
A U.N. investigation concluded on Wednesday that Israel has committed crimes against humanity during the war in Gaza, including that of "extermination", while saying Israeli and Palestinian armed groups have both committed war crimes.
It found that Israel had committed war crimes, crimes against humanity and violations of international humanitarian law (IHL) and international human rights law (IHRL).
The Gaza war broke out after Hamas' unprecedented October 7 attack allegedly resulted in the deaths of 1,194 people.
Since October 7, the three-member commission has focused on the Gaza war between Israel and Hamas.
"These actions constitute war crimes and violations and abuses of IHL and IHRL," it said.

Current events of security reported in text that can be placed on a map are:

- U.N. investigation concludes that Israel has committed crimes against humanity during the Gaza war.

- U.N. investigation finds that Hamas committed war crimes and war crimes during the Gaza war between Israel and Hamas.

title: The Garhwal Regiment glorious military heritage
message:
The sprawling Bungalow No 6 amongst a hundred such, constructed in 1906 was home to Colonel Mainwaring commandant of 3/9 Royal Garhwal Rifles and was bought by MES for a princely Rs 10,053!
Scattered but indistinguishable descendants of erstwhile Nepalese can be found in Pathankot village as are remnants of 2/3 Gorkha Rifles also raised here which have an umbilical cord with the Garhwal Regiment.
It was a silver replica of this Unknown Soldier that PM Modi presented to the PM of France in 2015 to commemorate the centenary of WWI.
The Darwan Singh War Museum is the grand repository of the history and achievements in war and peace of the Regiment.
The Garhwal regimental legacy is protected by its three symbols: Lord Badrinath, the regimental deity, the iconic Unknown Soldier and the Royal Rassi.

title: Russian ships arrive in Cuba as Cold War allies strengthen their ties
message:
CNN(CNN) — A group of Russian Navy ships, including a nuclear-powered submarine, arrived in Cuba on Wednesday morning in a sign of strengthening ties between the two Cold War allies.
A CNN team on the ground saw members of the small Russian community in Cuba and Russian diplomats carrying national flags to welcome the crews.
The four Russian ships are now docked in berths usually occupied by cruise ships.
The US has also deployed air assets, including a P-8 Poseidon reconnaissance plane, to circle overhead the Russian vessels.
According to a Cuban Armed Forces Ministry statement, none of the Russian ships are armed with nuclear weapons.
event_breakdown: Russia - The arrival of a group of Russian Navy ships, including a nuclear powered submarine, in Cuba on Wednesday.

title: In shadow of war , Lebanese find respite on southern beach
message:
Life goes on but "the children are frightened", the 60-year-old told AFP from the beach in Tyre, about 20 kilometres (12.4 miles) from the Israel-Lebanon frontier.
Lebanon's Hezbollah, a Hamas ally, and Israel have been trading near-daily fire since the Gaza war was trigged by the Palestinian militant group's October 7 attack on southern Israel.
"Let them (Israel) sit with their fear and we will sit with a beer," he added.
Summer tourism, in large part driven by Lebanese expatriates, is a crucial source of income for Tyre residents and small businesses.
"Despite the security situation... people (in the south) have no other outlet but this beach," he said.

title: Russia Calls for Swift Release of Its Nationals Held by Hamas
message:
i24 News – Russia’s Human Rights Commissioner Tatyana Moskalkova on Tuesday announced that she appealed to senior United Nations (UN) and other officials to take action to secure the release of Russian nationals held by Hamas in the Gaza Strip after eight months after their kidnapping.
According to her post on Telegram messaging app, Moskalkova launched the appeal after meeting in Moscow with relatives of those still being held.
News reports have put at eight the number of hostages holding Russian passports, including three who were released.
An Israeli-Russian dual national Andrey Kozlov was among the four hostages the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) rescued in an operation on Saturday.

title: Mindef signs deal for three Turkish LMS
message:
ANKARA: The Defence Ministry (Mindef) has handed over the letter of agreement (LOA) for the purchase of the second batch of three Littoral Mission Ships (LMS) to Turkiye defence company, Savunma Teknolojileri Muhendislik (STM).
“With the acquisition of this second batch of three LMS, it is hoped that it will help us reach the 18 ships needed for RMN.
The construction and equipping of the ship will be carried out in Turkiye, involving the cooperation of 50 companies from the Turkish defence sector.
The ship will be integrated with advanced systems and equipped with advanced weapon systems, sensors, and command and control systems that enable TLDM to carry out various missions effectively.
The second batch of LMS is an Ada-class corvette, a type of patrol and anti-submarine warfare (ASW) vessel equipped with advanced anti-aircraft missiles.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: The Defence Ministry (Mindef) has handed over the letter of agreement (LOA) for the purchase of three Littoral Mission Ships (LMS) to Turkiye defence company, Savunma Teknolojileri Muhendislik (STM).
Event 2: A new batch of LMS is an Ada-class corvette, a type of patrol and anti-submarine warfare (ASW) vessel equipped with advanced anti-aircraft missiles.
